@BeingCharisBlog Yup. I was once told I have chronic pain because I have the devil inside of me. She said I needed to go to the elders of her church to get saved. ü§¶üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

@beth_morton A1: Meds and procedures have not worked for me. One thing that seems to help at times is to dig my nails in different areas of my scalp. It can increase pain temporarily for me but then provide at least a perception of relief after. ü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è #migrainechat
@winedarkme Years of experience living with chronic illness and pain has taught me how to look normal when I feel horrid (makeup helps too!).
@paintoolkit2 Telehealth has also allowed me to work with patients who are in areas where they do not have access to a pain psychologist. So this is also a major benefit.

@paintoolkit2 For over 8 years I have offered in person or telehealth sessions to patients. My patients with pain love the option of turning their in person session last minute to telehealth if they are having a particularly bad physical day. It allows for continuity of treatment.
@LisaKeel9 Pain meds don't work for me (complex medical history). Just taking Tylenol for fever.
@jaforbes59 Pain meds don't work for me (complex medical history). Just taking Tylenol for fever.

-Spike a fever multiple times a day since March 14th (highest was 103) 
-Lung pain and pressure 
-Chest pain and pressure
-Difficulty breathing (mostly slow labored breathing)
-Full body aches 
-Fatigue 
-Get winded from standing or walking at times

I was diagnosed with #coronavirus earlier this week. I am home in quarantine. Every breath has been a struggle. I've had a fever on and off for 12 days. The pain in my lungs is nothing like I have ever felt. #StayHome #WeAreAllInThisTogether https://t.co/vkBZYNKrsL

@beth_morton I did have a bite guard made and wore it for a number of years. I would grind my teeth at night. I'm hoping it helps you. I don't remember the specifics of my pain at that time as that was probably 15 years ago.

@bennessb After living w/ #chronicpain for 20 years, after receiving diagnosis after diagnosis & mis-diagnosis, it feels like I have been through a healthcare war. I identify as a pain warrior because it symbolizes that I have been through the trenches & will continue to live my story.

@Jane_Doyle_EJD Thanks but I won't. Very complex stuff going on. Just taking one day at a time.
Hope your pain flare lessens soon.

@DrGolfShirt The severe pain from neurosurgery on my spinal cord for a rare condition followed by a CSF leak surgical repair about 10 days later. My body does not respond to pain pills/injections/patches/infusions. So recovery has been fun. üòú

@esteckler2 @Purrfectly_Rare @teaminspire Luckily that person was eventually fired due to her lack of expertise and a proper pain psychologist was hired. However she shouldn't have been hired in the first place. Sadly there are not a lot of pain psychologists.

@esteckler2 @Purrfectly_Rare @teaminspire So sad to hear you & your family went through this. You are correct--There are psychologists, counselors, social workers who say they are experts in pain who are not. A local pain clinic hired someone with no extensive pain training just because she was a psychologist.

@Purrfectly_Rare @teaminspire I agree with you completely. So many people go to counselors or social workers with no direct training in chronic pain and chronic illness. I have heard many horror stories from patients. Many ableist views or trying to get a patient with ME/CFS to overexercise etc etc
And let's not forget the severe #migraine attack that lasted 2 days and has finally lifted back to my "normal" chronic migraine levels.
@MigraineSummit I have COVID-19. I now have a COVID-19 related headache 24/7 on top of my 5 other migraine and headache diseases. :(
@beth_morton I have TMJ from wisdom teeth surgery. After that I started to get migraine attacks.

@BreatheMia @mikes_recovery Agreed! My waiting room does not have fluorescent lighting-- I bought multiple floor lamps to turn on instead. And I do not use the fluorescent lighting in my office. I also have accessible ice packs, a heating pad, blankets, pillows, and an assortment of migraine glasses. üíú‚ù§

@BreatheMia I hear you! I currently have a bad migraine with severe neck pain, but can't cancel my last patient as they are almost here. I will definitely pay for pushing through! But it is what is needed...
@migrainediva Congratulations! I am so excited for you and what this exposure will do for our migraine tribe! üíú‚ù§

Migraine has taken from me the inability to remember what it is like to live without constant head pain. This impacts every part of my life as my head feels like it is constantly in a fog and in a vice. #ChronicMigraine #MigraineThief https://t.co/850XCvPzBW

Prior to the ER, I hadn't slept for 72 hours, had a consistent fever over 101 for two days, had hot/cold sweats, and even hallucinated. All this on top of the already all consuming #coronavirus symptoms. So for all the idiots saying it's just the flu, let's have a chat. 2/2
@winedarkme Thanks! Sending love right back! I do have a fever right now :(
@BreatheMia @liquidiv Sadly no. Fever is back daily again.
@katwardphoto I have had COVID since ~March 14th. Had a fever daily for over 25 days until it broke. Thought it wouldn't come back after that!

Some good news: yesterday was the first time in 25 days that I didn't spike a fever over 100! 8/end

#weareallinthistogether #staythefuckhome
@Mercedes62J I already had put myself in isolation due to my other symptoms before the fever started. And yes, I informed all my patients and colleagues. I work in private practice.

Yesterday my doctor sent me to get labs and an EKG. An outpatient nurse took one look at me and sent me to the ER. Was there for half the day. IV fluids for dehydration and IV antibiotics for a wonderful new infection. #coronavirus 1/2 https://t.co/oBfj8MtcpH
@JMB1122AZ @AntarianRani @MelodyLeslie I had 2 rounds of antibiotics already before I tested positive.

@MsRoniAnne I think most people are hearing about the mild or no symptoms cases and then the hospitalized cases. There are a bunch of us who are sick well over 40 days with active symptoms.
@winedarkme Thanks! Sending love right back! I do have a fever right now :(
I inquired about getting a CT scan instead of an xray. COVID+ patients are not allowed to as they want to keep contamination down for the cancer patients that need to use them. 3/
@traependergrast The amount of stuff like this I have been told to do that with cure my coronavirus...I pulled my neck muscles from shaking my head! Everyone is an expert! https://t.co/1EZEtbHZkX
@merlinus Just started medication yesterday for the ear infection. Which comes at a risk of making the virus worse from my limited understanding of it. Tylenol does not help with my fevers or pain.

#Coronavirus: Day 1,254 (Real time: Day 18) 

I now have an inner ear infection: significant vertigo, dizziness, nausea, ear pain, worse migraine, more hot sweats, increase in temperature. Anytime I move positions even slightly the room spins and I feel like I'm going to vomit. https://t.co/1sjtrUiVVD
Now I also have an inner ear infection in my right ear causing significant vertigo, dizziness, nausea, ear pain, worse migraine, more hot sweats, increase in temp.

@kari_jerge #MedTwitter Any tips on how I can better support my neck in prone while at home fighting #coronavirus? I have a rare neural tube defect (tethered cord syndrome) among other dx that make it difficult to lay on my stomach too long. Had neurosurgery on my spinalcord in Oct. THANKS!
@JessicaSmits7 I also have a rare neural tube defect (tethered cord syndrome) and had neurosurgery on my spinal cord in October. So it's difficult for me to lay in the prone position for too long.

@JessicaSmits7 Thank you.
Not really but I keep laying prone periodically anyway. My oxygen levels are within normal range.

For all the mask comments: This picture was taken during ER trip #2 before discharge. I'm super sick, it was all I had around the house, decided to wear it to the ER. I didn't find out I tested positive for #coronavirus until the next night. I am not wearing this mask at home.

#Cornoavirus #HighRiskCovid19

Every morning I complete a questionnaire sent by the hospital I tested positive at. It tracks my symptoms. https://t.co/VdXPsOe4Rs

Must be nice to be so able-bodied that you don't even take into consideration that even the common cold can cause severe illness for people with compromised immune systems. Geez, don't kill us off yet! #WashYourDamnHands #IsaidWhatIsaid #ChronicIllness https://t.co/h4gLRNpmcE

@BeckyHill3 I absolutely agree. It was a traumatic experience where I had spinal fluid leaking from my low back after a violent vomiting episode in a parking lot! Just 10 days after neurosurgery I had to be reopened and have the CSF leak surgically repaired. #StillProcessing #YouAreNotAlone
